poem:
**A Morning Under the Headlines**

The ink bleeds across the page,
a landslide of hope in a gray land.
Fourteen percent, Farage's shadow lingers,
while Europe leans the other way,
and Trump waits in the wings.
Politics weave through my quiet kitchen,
the toast springs up
golden,
as the world tilts on its pivot.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Is UK bucking Europe’s trend of moving to the right? Labour’s landslide victory was hailed as a beacon of hope for progressives worldwide after a surge in support for far-right parties in Europe, and with Donald Trump currently slight favourite to become the US president in January. But Britain’s bulwark against the populist, extremist tide sweeping through European capitals may be as much practical as ideological. Nigel Farage’s rightwing Reform party got a 14% share". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
